It is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, featuring broad, flat leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the spring season. Its growth habit is typically low and spreading, adapting to rocky and well-drained environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern in its native range.
